items.title: Sarkozy says he will ‘sleep in jail but with head held high’ after conviction
bullets: • First time a former head of state has been sent to prison in modern French history

• Sentence follows trial in which he and his aides were accused of making a corruption pact with the late Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi to receive funding for the 2007 French presidential election campaign

items.title: Tropical Storm Imelda forming and expected to become hurricane
bullets: • Tropical Storm Imelda is now a category 4 storm with maximum sustained winds of 40mph
• The storm is expected to move east-northeastward from Florida to the Bahamas
• A tropical storm watch is in effect for parts of the Florida coast

items.title: Trump threatens mass firings of federal workers if government shutdown isn't averted, NBC News reports
bullets: • The White House has warned of mass firings if the government shuts down this week
• President Donald Trump told NBC News that "we are going to cut a lot of the people that
• we're able to cut on a permanent basis" If the White House follows through on its threat, it would mark a break from precedent

items.title: Eric Adams drops out of New York City mayoral race
bullets: • New York City Mayor Eric Adams announced Sunday that he is suspending his bid for re-election
• His announcement could give a boost to former Gov
• Andrew Cuomo in the race against the Democratic nominee Zohran Mamdani
• President Donald Trump has suggested that Adams and Curtis Sliwa, the Republican nominee, should both drop out of the race

items.title: Eric Adams drops out of New York City mayoral race
bullets: • Eric Adams announced on Sunday that he is abandoning his faltering bid to win re-election in New York City
• Adams was indicted on corruption charges but dropped by the Trump administration in exchange for his cooperation on immigration raids
• The mayor will serve the remainder of his term in office, which ends on New Year's Eve

items.title: GOP leaders say Obamacare tax credit fight can wait until after government shutdown is averted
bullets: • House Speaker Mike Johnson, R-La., said the Obamacare subsidies are a policy debate that has to be determined by the end of the year
• Senate Majority Leader John Thune called Obamacare a program "in desperate need of reform" President Donald Trump is set to meet with the top four congressional leaders on Monday

items.title: Stowaway found dead in landing gear of American Airlines flight in Charlotte
bullets: • Stowaway found dead in landing gear of American Airlines flight in Charlotte, N.C., police say
• Police say they are investigating the death of a stowaway
• American Airlines says it is "working with law enforcement on its investigation"

items.title: Suspect held after allegedly firing from boat into waterfront bar in North Carolina
bullets: • Three people were injured in the attack on a bar in South Carolina
• Police say they believe the suspect acted alone
• The incident happened at 10 p.m
• on Saturday night
• The victims were "clinging for their lives," a police official says

items.title: At least 40 dead in crush at political rally in India
bullets: • At least 40 dead in crush at political rally in southern Indian state of Tamil Nadu
• Victims included nine children, at least 17 women, and 13 men, officials say
• Police have filed a case against three senior members of Vijay's TVK party

items.title: Ryder Cup MC steps down over foul-mouthed chant aimed at golfer Rory McIlroy
bullets: • PGA of America says it has apologized to Rory McIlroy and the Ryder Cup team
• Fans in Long Island, N.Y., started chanting expletives at the start of the tournament
• McIlory has faced the brunt of the jeering from spectators

items.title: Namibia deploys army to fight wildfire burning third of Etosha game reserve
bullets: • Namibia has begun deploying hundreds of soldiers to fight a fire that has burned through a third of Etosha national park
• The park in the north of the largely desert country is home to 114 species of mammals, notably the critically endangered black rhinoceros
• The fire had been burning since 22 September and had caused extensive ecological damage

items.title: Attack at a Mormon church in Michigan leaves at least 4 dead, 8 injured
bullets: • Attack at a Mormon church in Michigan leaves at least 4 dead, 8 injured, police say
• Two additional bodies have been found at the burned-out church, adding to the death toll of two
• The 40-year-old suspect, Thomas Jacob Sanford, was killed by police, authorities say

items.title: Doctors tested a common drug on COVID. The results are stunning
bullets: • Inhaled heparin significantly lowers the risk of death and ventilation in COVID-19 patients
• With its unique triple-action benefits, it could serve as a powerful and accessible treatment worldwide
• Heparin has anti-inflammatory and pan-antiviral properties

items.title: Palestinian death toll tops 66,000 as Netanyahu prepares to meet Trump
bullets: • Palestinian death toll tops 66,000 Palestinians, Gaza's Health Ministry says
• Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu heads to the White House for talks with U.S
• President Donald Trump
• Israeli security forces shot dead the alleged attacker in a car-ramming incident
• Violence has surged in the Israeli-occupied West Bank, which was captured by Israel in 1967

items.title: Zelensky condemns 'vile' Russian strikes lasting 12 hours
bullets: • A 12-year-old girl among those killed in 'vile' Russian aerial bombardment that lasted more than 12 hours
• Russia said it struck military facilities and industrial enterprises supporting Ukraine's armed forces
• President Volodymyr Zelensky said the deaths all occurred in the capital Kyiv

items.title: Fruit might be the surprising key to healthier lungs
bullets: • Researchers point to antioxidants and anti-inflammatory compounds in fruit as possible defenses against harmful airborne particles
• The study was presented at the European Respiratory Society Congress in Amsterdam, the Netherlands
• Over 90% of the global population is exposed to air pollution levels that exceed WHO guidelines

items.title: 30 years later, I’m still obliterating planets in Master of Orion II—and you can, too
bullets: • Master of Orion II (MOO2) is a game that has you develop and build up planets across a simple galaxy map
• The deeper and longer the experience, the better the payoff can be
• The games I love the most are the ones where you make decisions that compound over many hours to a long-term payoff

items.title: 150 million-year-old pterosaur cold case has finally been solved
bullets: • Pterodactylus antiquus hatchlings were found in the Solnhofen Limestones of Germany
• Their bones showed how they had succumbed to storm winds
• Unable to fly, they drowned and were rapidly buried in the lagoon depths

items.title: Sanctions reimposed on Iran 10 years after landmark nuclear deal
bullets: • Sanctions reimposed on Iran 10 years after landmark nuclear deal was struck
• UK, France and Germany activate the so-called "snapback" mechanism
• Iran suspended inspections of its nuclear facilities in June after Israel and the US pulled out of the deal

items.title: The accidental discovery that forged the Iron Age
bullets: • The accidental discovery that forged the Iron Age reveals how ancient curiosity paved the way for one of humanity’s most transformative materials
• Researchers reanalyzed metallurgical remains from a 3,000-year-old smelting workshop in Georgia

items.title: Why “dry” oil wells aren’t really empty
bullets: • Researchers harnessed PSC's Bridges-2 supercomputer, adding a time dimension and amplitude analysis to traditional seismic data
• Their findings revealed hidden rock structures blocking oil flow, meaning reserves weren’t gone—they were trapped
• Breakthrough could lead to smarter drilling, unlocking overlooked oil and reducing waste in energy production

items.title: New Jersey Sen. Andy Kim discusses how Democrats are negotiating to avoid a shutdown
bullets: • New Jersey Sen
• Andy Kim discusses how Democrats are negotiating to avoid a shutdown
• Kim: "I'm glad that President Trump changed his mind
• I think it shows that the president is feeling pressure from his position before saying that he doesn't want to deal with Democrats"

items.title: Politics chat: Trump says he'll deploy troops to Portland, James Comey indicted
bullets: • Politics chat: Trump says he'll deploy troops to Portland, Oregon, to handle "domestic terrorists" Former FBI Director James Comey has been indicted by the Justice Department
• A government shutdown could come Wednesday and the Trump administration is threatening large-scale layoffs of federal workers

items.title: The endangered cactus behind Mexico's sweet secret
bullets: • Barches of barrel cactus have been chopped up and seeped in vats of sugar until they're crystalized
• The Mexican government began banning the sale of acitrón in the early 2000s
• The biznaga cactus was found to be in danger of extinction due to overexploitation

items.title: DACA has bipartisan support in Congress. Still, Republicans are following Trump's lead
bullets: • Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program created in 2012 to protect children from deportation
• Republican lawmakers are open to a permanent solution to the problem
• Nearly 20 DACA recipients have been caught in the cross-fire of the program this year
• The program has bipartisan support in Congress

items.title: Russian strikes kill 4 in Ukraine as Zelenskyy urges world not to "turn a blind eye"
bullets: • Russian strikes kill 4 in Ukraine as Zelenskyy urges world not to "turn a blind eye" At least four of the dead were in Kyiv, including a 12-year-old girl
• At least 70 others were injured in the assault, which killed at least four people nationwide

items.title: Stampede at a political rally for popular actor Vijay in southern India kills 36, injures 40
bullets: • At least 36 people are killed in a stampede at a rally in India
• The victims were trying to get close to the stage
• The incident occurred during a speech by Vijay Patel
• The crowd began to fall in the middle of the rally

items.title: Autism may be the price of human intelligence
bullets: • Specific neurons in the outer brain evolved rapidly, and autism-linked genes changed under natural selection
• These shifts may have slowed brain development in children while boosting language and cognition
• Globally, the World Health Organization estimates that around one in 100 children have autism

items.title: NoViolet Bulawayo wins the Best of Caine award
bullets: • Best of Caine Prize for African Writing is awarded for a short story
• The story examines the lives of a group of children in Budapest, Hungary
• The winner of the award will be announced at the end of the month
• The award was handed out at the British Library in London today

items.title: Tropical Storm Imelda expected to batter parts of the southeastern U.S. this week
bullets: • Parts of the U.S
• are expected to be hit by Tropical Storm I-Bahamas
• The storm is expected to bring heavy rain to parts of the country
• Parts of South Carolina, Florida and Georgia are in the path of the storm
• The hurricane is a tropical depression

items.title: The current war on science, and who’s behind it
bullets: • Michael Mann is a climate scientist at the University of Pennsylvania who, in 1998, developed the notorious hockey stick graph
• Peter Hotez is a microbiologist and pediatrician at Baylor College of Medicine whose group developed a low-cost, patent-free vaccine using public funds

items.title: Why LA Comic Con thought making an AI-powered Stan Lee hologram was a good idea
bullets: • A "AI Stan Lee hologram" will be appearing at the LA Comic Con this weekend
• Fans will be able to pay $15 to $20 to see the AI-powered avatar of Lee in an enclosed booth at the show
• The instant response from many fans and media outlets to the idea was not kind
• The CEO of the parent company behind the event urged critics to come see the hologram for themselves

items.title: ‘A donkey cart out of El Fasher costs more than a new car’: how 500 days under siege is tearing the city apart
bullets: • El Fasher, North Darfur’s capital, has been trapped in one of the longest urban sieges of modern warfare
• The siege, progressively tightened by the Rapid Support Forces (RSF), has transformed the city
• Civilians move block by block in search of safety, while self-defence groups fight alongside entrenched garrisons

items.title: Is taking acetaminophen during pregnancy really associated with autism in children?
bullets: • President Trump suggested that taking acetaminophen during pregnancy is linked to autism in children
• Doctors disagree and say there's no strong evidence for that
• Tylenol could play a role in ongoing legal cases against the company that makes it
• NPR's pharmaceuticals correspondent, Sydney Lupkin, joins us in the comments

items.title: Meteorite collectors gather in Cincinnati this weekend for 'Meet a Meteorite'
bullets: • Meteorite collectors gather in Cincinnati this weekend for 'Meet a Meteorite' The rocks that hurtle from outer space and make it to Earth get a moment to shine
• At the Cincinnati Observatory later today, collectors will be showing off some of their treasures

items.title: Four killed in shooting and arson attack at Mormon church in Michigan
bullets: • Four killed in shooting and arson attack at Mormon church in Michigan
• Gunman drove vehicle into church, opened fire and set it ablaze, police say
• Thomas Jacob Sanford, 40, was later shot dead by police in the church car park
• Police are investigating the incident as an "act of targeted violence"

items.title: China’s stock market has been on a roll — is it a boom or a bubble?
bullets: • China's stock market has seen a sharp rally this year as progress on artificial-intelligence and Beijing's campaign to rein in price wars fuel investor optimism
• The CSI 300 Information Technology Index last week hit its highest level since 2015
• Total Chinese household savings currently stand at more than 160 trillion yuan ($22 trillion)

items.title: Sony Financial Group shares soar 36% in trading debut as Asia markets mostly rise
bullets: • Shares in Sony Financial Group rose 36% on market debut Monday after parent company Sony Group spun off the unit
• Sony said separation allows the financial arm to raise its own growth capital while maintaining brand ties with the wider Sony ecosystem
• The parent company cited competing demands for investment in entertainment and semiconductors as a key reason for the financial unit to operate independently

items.title: At least four dead and eight injured after shooting at Mormon church in Michigan
bullets: • At least four people were killed and eight others injured after a gunman opened fire at a Mormon church in Michigan
• Two more bodies were found in the charred remains of the building, police said
• The 40-year-old male suspect was later identified by officials as Thomas Jacob Sanford, a former Marine

items.title: Trump news at a glance: more than 100,000 federal workers to quit on Tuesday in largest ever mass resignation
bullets: • More than 100,000 federal workers to quit on Tuesday in largest ever mass resignation program
• Congress facing deadline of Tuesday to authorize more funding or spark a government shutdown
• White House has also ordered federal agencies to draw up plans for large-scale firings of workers

items.title: Pro-EU party in Moldova wins election mired in claims of Russian interference
bullets: • President Maia Sandu's Party of Action and Solidarity (PAS) close to winning 50% of the vote
• Opposition leader Igor Dodon had claimed victory even before results started coming in
• Turnout was over 52%, higher than in recent years

items.title: Oregon sues to block ‘illegal’ deployment of 200 national guard troops to Portland
bullets: • The state of Oregon filed a lawsuit in federal court on Sunday seeking to block the deployment of 200 national guard troops to Portland, arguing Donald Trump’s characterization of the peaceful city as “war ravaged” is “pure fiction” The governor of Oregon said she had been notified by the Pentagon that the US president had seized control of the state's reservists

items.title: Can AI detect hedgehogs from space? Maybe if you find brambles first.
bullets: • Scientists are using satellite imagery and AI models to map hedgehog habitats across the UK
• European hedgehog populations have declined by roughly 30 to 50 percent over the past decade
• Traditional hedgehog surveys require nighttime fieldwork, specialized equipment, or citizen scientists reporting sightings

items.title: World must deny Israel ‘tools of genocide’, says growing alliance of activist states
bullets: • Malaysian foreign minister Mohamad Hasan said the international community has a legal and moral duty to deny Israel ‘the tools of genocide’ The Hague Group is a growing alliance of countries dedicated to coordinating practical economic and legal steps to isolate Israel over the war in Gaza

items.title: 'Long history of blaming mothers': Trump's Tylenol warning echoes past misconceptions
bullets: • President Trump urged pregnant women to "tough it out" and take Tylenol sparingly
• Medical experts have strongly pushed back on the guidance, arguing that such claims are misleading
• The Food and Drug Administration later clarified that "while an association between acetaminophen and autism has been described in many studies"

items.title: Apple’s ‘Veritas’ chatbot is reportedly an employee-only test of Siri’s AI upgrades
bullets: • Apple is reportedly testing Siri’s upcoming revamp using an internal chatbot called Veritas
• The next-gen Siri has been delayed multiple times and the debut of Apple Intelligence was met with a tepid response
• According to Bloomberg, Veritas resembles other chatbot apps like ChatGPT and Gemini
• There's no plans for a public release as Cupertino will likely rely on Google's Gemini for AI search

items.title: Larry Ellison’s quest to run the world
bullets: • Larry Ellison has begun a second act shifting from Silicon Valley pioneer, to media mogul
• Ellison has developed a reputation for ruthless and sometimes ethically dubious behavior as head of Oracle
• The company's biggest products are cloud computing and database products that it sells to enterprise customers

items.title: Trump posts, then pulls bizarre AI video promoting MedBed conspiracy
bullets: • The president posted (and later removed) a clip on Truth Social of a fake Fox News segment with Lara Trump detailing the White House’s announcement of a MedBed hospital and a national MedBed card system
• The video appears to be completely AI generated, including Trump himself discussing the program in the Oval Office
• MedBeds are an imaginary medical device that can do everything from treat asthma, to regrow missing limbs, to cure cancer

items.title: I spent three months with Telly, the free TV that’s always showing ads
bullets: • Free TV has a built-in screen that shows ads in the middle of the screen
• The screen stays on at all times, even if you turn off the power button
• This is the first time I've seen a free TV with ads in it, and the last few months it's free

items.title: Good news: TechWoven is fine
bullets: • Apple’s follow-up to FineWoven holds up a lot better than its predecessor
• The TechWoven case for the iPhone 17 Pro is less silky, more rugged, and much more difficult to scratch
• Apple introduced the material in 2023 when the company discontinued its leather cases and accessories
